repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem: The stdin reading path does not close `stdin_dup` or free `sb` upon early exit.

Solution: Free the resources before returning false.

comment_data.body: perhaps this cleanup routine should go in a `exit` label after the `return true` at bottom of this function
Personally, I think this is fine. `goto`'s are genuinely evil.

That was the plan before, but I heard goto's were evil so I didn't. It also put the filedescriptor and stringbuilder into the upper scope where I don't think it needs to be

I pushed a commit using the label

I think this is definitely worse now. Before all the string builder logic was properly scoped, but now because of the goto you've had to increase the scope of these variables despite the fact they aren't used between lines 1834-1864.

The diff is also bigger instead of the +4 that it was before. I think this is a classic case of when DRY can be bad.

> but I heard goto's were evil so I didn't

Lol, looks like you heard correctly ðŸ˜‰
Thanks for the insight. I'll revert to the first commit if that's what you two want to use.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(coverity/530026,530028): free resources on early exit in nlua_exec_file
